      • stripRef

        public static String stripRef(String inputURL)
        Strip the ref from a URL, if present
        Returns:
        The base URL, without the ref. The original String is returned if it has no ref, of if the input is malformed.

      • decodeUserEnteredUrl

        public static String decodeUserEnteredUrl(String url)
        Given a url with a user-entered scheme, extract the scheme-specific component. For e.g, given "user-entered://www.google.com", this method returns "//www.google.com". If the passed url does not have a user-entered scheme, the same url will be returned.
        Parameters:
        url - to be decoded
        Returns:
        url component entered by user

      • encodeUserEnteredUrl

        public static String encodeUserEnteredUrl(String url)

      • getQueryParameterNames

        public static java.util.Set<String> getQueryParameterNames(android.net.Uri uri)
        Compatibility layer for API < 11. Returns a set of the unique names of all query parameters. Iterating over the set will return the names in order of their first occurrence.
        Parameters:
        uri -
        Returns:
        a set of decoded names
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this isn't a hierarchical URI

      • pathStartIndex

        public static int pathStartIndex(String text)
        Returns:
        the index of the path segment of URLs

                                   String str,

      • isRTL

        public static boolean isRTL(String text)
        Check if this might be a RTL (right-to-left) text by looking at the first character.

      • forceLTR

        public static String forceLTR(String text)
        Force LTR (left-to-right) by prepending the text with the "left-to-right mark" (U+200E) if needed.

      • getTextWidth

        public static int getTextWidth(String text,
                               int start,
                               int end,
                               android.graphics.Paint textPaint)
        Measures the width of the given substring when rendered using the specified Paint.
        Parameters:
        text - String to measure and return its width
        start - Index of the first char in the string to measure
        end - 1 past the last char in the string measure
        textPaint - the paint used to render the text
        Returns:
        the width of the specified substring in screen pixels
